papers.title: SuperGPQA: Scaling LLM Evaluation across 285 Graduate Disciplines
papers.abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable proficiency in mainstream academic disciplines such as mathematics, physics, and computer science. However, human knowledge encompasses over 200 specialized disciplines, far exceeding the scope of existing benchmarks. The capabilities of LLMs in many of these specialized fields-particularly in light industry, agriculture, and service-oriented disciplines-remain inadequately evaluated. To address this gap, we present SuperGPQA, a comprehensive benchmark that evaluates graduate-level knowledge and reasoning capabilities across 285 disciplines. Our benchmark employs a novel Human-LLM collaborative filtering mechanism to eliminate trivial or ambiguous questions through iterative refinement based on both LLM responses and expert feedback. Our experimental results reveal significant room for improvement in the performance of current state-of-the-art LLMs across diverse knowledge domains (e.g., the reasoning-focused model DeepSeek-R1 achieved the highest accuracy of 61.82% on SuperGPQA), highlighting the considerable gap between current model capabilities and artificial general intelligence. Additionally, we present comprehensive insights from our management of a large-scale annotation process, involving over 80 expert annotators and an interactive Human-LLM collaborative system, offering valuable methodological guidance for future research initiatives of comparable scope.

ru.title: SuperGPQA: Масштабная оценка знаний ИИ в 285 дисциплинах
ru.desc: Статья представляет SuperGPQA - комплексный бенчмарк для оценки знаний и навыков рассуждения языковых моделей на уровне выпускников вузов по 285 дисциплинам. Бенчмарк использует механизм коллаборативной фильтрации с участием человека и ИИ для устранения тривиальных или неоднозначных вопросов. Результаты экспериментов показывают значительный потенциал для улучшения производительности современных языковых моделей в различных областях знаний. Авторы также делятся опытом управления крупномасштабным процессом аннотации с участием более 80 экспертов.

en.title: Bridging the Knowledge Gap: SuperGPQA for Evaluating LLMs Across Disciplines
en.desc: This paper introduces SuperGPQA, a new benchmark designed to assess the knowledge and reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs) across 285 specialized disciplines. It highlights the limitations of current LLMs, which have shown strong performance in mainstream fields but lack evaluation in many specialized areas like light industry and agriculture. The benchmark uses a Human-LLM collaborative filtering approach to refine questions, ensuring they are relevant and clear, based on feedback from both LLMs and human experts. Results indicate that there is significant potential for improvement in LLM performance, emphasizing the gap between current capabilities and the goal of achieving artificial general intelligence.

zh.title: 评估大型语言模型的全面基准测试
zh.desc: 大型语言模型（LLMs）在数学、物理和计算机科学等主流学科中表现出色，但在200多个专业领域的能力仍未得到充分评估。为了解决这一问题，我们提出了SuperGPQA，这是一个全面的基准测试，评估285个学科的研究生水平知识和推理能力。该基准采用新颖的人类-LLM协作过滤机制，通过基于LLM响应和专家反馈的迭代优化，消除琐碎或模糊的问题。实验结果显示，当前最先进的LLMs在不同知识领域的表现仍有显著提升空间，表明现有模型能力与人工通用智能之间存在较大差距。

papers.title: SigLIP 2: Multilingual Vision-Language Encoders with Improved Semantic Understanding, Localization, and Dense Features
papers.abstract: We introduce SigLIP 2, a family of new multilingual vision-language encoders that build on the success of the original SigLIP. In this second iteration, we extend the original image-text training objective with several prior, independently developed techniques into a unified recipe -- this includes captioning-based pretraining, self-supervised losses (self-distillation, masked prediction) and online data curation. With these changes, SigLIP 2 models outperform their SigLIP counterparts at all model scales in core capabilities, including zero-shot classification, image-text retrieval, and transfer performance when extracting visual representations for Vision-Language Models (VLMs). Furthermore, the new training recipe leads to significant improvements on localization and dense prediction tasks. We also train variants which support multiple resolutions and preserve the input's native aspect ratio. Finally, we train on a more diverse data-mixture that includes de-biasing techniques, leading to much better multilingual understanding and improved fairness. To allow users to trade off inference cost with performance, we release model checkpoints at four sizes: ViT-B (86M), L (303M), So400m (400M), and g (1B).

ru.title: SigLIP 2: Многоязычный энкодер нового поколения для обработки визуальной и текстовой информации
ru.desc: SigLIP 2 представляет собой новое семейство многоязычных энкодеров для обработки визуальной и текстовой информации. Модель улучшает оригинальный SigLIP, добавляя несколько техник, включая предобучение на основе генерации подписей, самоконтролируемые потери и онлайн-курацию данных. SigLIP 2 превосходит предшественника в задачах классификации без примеров, поиска изображений по тексту и переноса обучения для визуально-языковых моделей. Модель также демонстрирует улучшения в задачах локализации и плотного предсказания, поддерживает несколько разрешений и сохраняет исходное соотношение сторон входных данных.

en.title: Elevating Multilingual Vision-Language Understanding with SigLIP 2
en.desc: SigLIP 2 is a new family of multilingual vision-language encoders that enhances the original SigLIP model. It incorporates advanced training techniques such as captioning-based pretraining and self-supervised losses, which improve its performance in tasks like zero-shot classification and image-text retrieval. The model also excels in localization and dense prediction tasks, thanks to a more diverse training dataset and de-biasing methods. Additionally, SigLIP 2 offers various model sizes to balance performance and inference cost for users.

zh.title: SigLIP 2：多语言视觉-语言编码的新突破
zh.desc: 我们介绍了SigLIP 2，这是一个新的多语言视觉-语言编码器系列，基于原始SigLIP的成功。在第二个版本中，我们将原始的图像-文本训练目标与多个独立开发的技术结合，形成一个统一的训练方案。这些改进使得SigLIP 2模型在零-shot分类、图像-文本检索和视觉表示提取等核心能力上超越了SigLIP的对手。此外，我们还训练了支持多种分辨率的变体，并在更具多样性的数据混合上进行训练，以提高多语言理解和公平性。

papers.title: LongWriter-V: Enabling Ultra-Long and High-Fidelity Generation in Vision-Language Models
papers.abstract: Existing Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) can process inputs with context lengths up to 128k visual and text tokens, yet they struggle to generate coherent outputs beyond 1,000 words. We find that the primary limitation is the absence of long output examples during supervised fine-tuning (SFT). To tackle this issue, we introduce LongWriter-V-22k, a SFT dataset comprising 22,158 examples, each with multiple input images, an instruction, and corresponding outputs ranging from 0 to 10,000 words. Moreover, to achieve long outputs that maintain high-fidelity to the input images, we employ Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) to the SFT model. Given the high cost of collecting human feedback for lengthy outputs (e.g., 3,000 words), we propose IterDPO, which breaks long outputs into segments and uses iterative corrections to form preference pairs with the original outputs. Additionally, we develop MMLongBench-Write, a benchmark featuring six tasks to evaluate the long-generation capabilities of VLMs. Our 7B parameter model, trained with LongWriter-V-22k and IterDPO, achieves impressive performance on this benchmark, outperforming larger proprietary models like GPT-4o. Code and data: https://github.com/THU-KEG/LongWriter-V
affiliations: Singapore University of Technology and Design

ru.title: Прорыв в генерации длинных текстов мультимодальными моделями
ru.desc: Исследователи представили новый подход к улучшению способности моделей машинного обучения генерировать длинные тексты на основе визуальных и текстовых входных данных. Они создали датасет LongWriter-V-22k для обучения моделей генерации длинных текстов и разработали метод IterDPO для оптимизации качества выходных данных. Авторы также предложили бенчмарк MMLongBench-Write для оценки способностей моделей к генерации длинных текстов. Их модель с 7 миллиардами параметров превзошла более крупные проприетарные модели в этой задаче.

en.title: Unlocking Long-Form Generation in Vision-Language Models
en.desc: This paper addresses the limitations of existing Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) in generating coherent long outputs. The authors introduce LongWriter-V-22k, a new supervised fine-tuning dataset with over 22,000 examples designed to improve long-form generation capabilities. They also propose Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) and IterDPO to enhance the model's ability to produce high-quality outputs by using iterative corrections on segmented long outputs. The results show that their 7B parameter model, trained with this new dataset and techniques, outperforms larger models like GPT-4o on a newly developed benchmark for long-generation tasks.

zh.title: 突破长输出限制，提升生成能力！
zh.desc: 现有的大型视觉语言模型（LVLMs）能够处理多达128k的视觉和文本标记，但在生成超过1000字的连贯输出时存在困难。我们发现，主要限制在于监督微调（SFT）过程中缺乏长输出示例。为了解决这个问题，我们引入了LongWriter-V-22k，这是一个包含22,158个示例的SFT数据集，每个示例都有多个输入图像、指令和对应的输出，字数范围从0到10,000字。此外，我们采用直接偏好优化（DPO）来实现与输入图像高度一致的长输出。

papers.title: Does Time Have Its Place? Temporal Heads: Where Language Models Recall Time-specific Information
papers.abstract: While the ability of language models to elicit facts has been widely investigated, how they handle temporally changing facts remains underexplored. We discover Temporal Heads, specific attention heads primarily responsible for processing temporal knowledge through circuit analysis. We confirm that these heads are present across multiple models, though their specific locations may vary, and their responses differ depending on the type of knowledge and its corresponding years. Disabling these heads degrades the model's ability to recall time-specific knowledge while maintaining its general capabilities without compromising time-invariant and question-answering performances. Moreover, the heads are activated not only numeric conditions ("In 2004") but also textual aliases ("In the year ..."), indicating that they encode a temporal dimension beyond simple numerical representation. Furthermore, we expand the potential of our findings by demonstrating how temporal knowledge can be edited by adjusting the values of these heads.

ru.title: Раскрытие тайн временного измерения в нейронных сетях
ru.desc: Исследователи обнаружили в языковых моделях специальные механизмы внимания, названные 'Временными головами', которые отвечают за обработку временной информации. Эти механизмы присутствуют в различных моделях и по-разному реагируют на разные типы знаний и годы. Отключение этих 'голов' ухудшает способность модели вспоминать знания, связанные с конкретным временем, но не влияет на общие возможности. Исследователи также показали, что эти механизмы активируются не только числовыми, но и текстовыми временными указателями.

en.title: Unlocking Temporal Knowledge in Language Models
en.desc: This paper investigates how language models manage facts that change over time, introducing the concept of Temporal Heads. These are specific attention heads in the model that focus on processing temporal knowledge, and they are found in various models, although their positions differ. The study shows that turning off these heads impairs the model's ability to recall time-specific information, while its overall performance remains intact. Additionally, the research reveals that these heads can respond to both numerical and textual temporal cues, and they can be manipulated to edit temporal knowledge.

zh.title: 揭示语言模型中的时间知识处理
zh.desc: 这篇论文探讨了语言模型如何处理时间变化的事实，发现了名为时间头的特定注意力头。通过电路分析，我们确认这些时间头在多个模型中存在，尽管它们的位置可能不同。禁用这些时间头会降低模型回忆时间特定知识的能力，但不会影响其一般能力。我们还展示了如何通过调整这些头的值来编辑时间知识，表明它们编码了超越简单数字表示的时间维度。

papers.title: PC-Agent: A Hierarchical Multi-Agent Collaboration Framework for Complex Task Automation on PC
papers.abstract: In the field of MLLM-based GUI agents, compared to smartphones, the PC scenario not only features a more complex interactive environment, but also involves more intricate intra- and inter-app workflows. To address these issues, we propose a hierarchical agent framework named PC-Agent. Specifically, from the perception perspective, we devise an Active Perception Module (APM) to overcome the inadequate abilities of current MLLMs in perceiving screenshot content. From the decision-making perspective, to handle complex user instructions and interdependent subtasks more effectively, we propose a hierarchical multi-agent collaboration architecture that decomposes decision-making processes into Instruction-Subtask-Action levels. Within this architecture, three agents (i.e., Manager, Progress and Decision) are set up for instruction decomposition, progress tracking and step-by-step decision-making respectively. Additionally, a Reflection agent is adopted to enable timely bottom-up error feedback and adjustment. We also introduce a new benchmark PC-Eval with 25 real-world complex instructions. Empirical results on PC-Eval show that our PC-Agent achieves a 32% absolute improvement of task success rate over previous state-of-the-art methods. The code will be publicly available.
affiliations: MAIS, Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, China

ru.title: Иерархические ИИ-агенты для сложных задач на ПК
ru.desc: В статье представлен иерархический фреймворк агентов PC-Agent для работы с графическим интерфейсом на ПК с использованием мультимодальных языковых моделей (MLLM). Предложен модуль активного восприятия (APM) для улучшения анализа скриншотов. Разработана иерархическая архитектура мультиагентного взаимодействия с тремя агентами для декомпозиции инструкций, отслеживания прогресса и пошагового принятия решений. Введен новый бенчмарк PC-Eval, на котором PC-Agent показал улучшение успешности выполнения задач на 32% по сравнению с предыдущими методами.

en.title: Empowering MLLM Agents for Complex PC Interactions
en.desc: This paper presents a new framework called PC-Agent designed for MLLM-based GUI agents in complex PC environments. It introduces an Active Perception Module (APM) to enhance the ability of models to interpret screenshot content effectively. The framework employs a hierarchical multi-agent collaboration architecture that breaks down decision-making into manageable levels: Instruction, Subtask, and Action. The results demonstrate a significant improvement in task success rates, showcasing the effectiveness of the proposed approach in handling intricate user instructions and workflows.

zh.title: PC-Agent：提升复杂任务处理能力的分层代理框架
zh.desc: 在基于MLLM的图形用户界面代理领域，PC场景比智能手机场景更复杂，涉及更复杂的应用内和应用间工作流程。为了解决这些问题，我们提出了一个名为PC-Agent的分层代理框架。该框架通过主动感知模块（APM）增强了当前MLLM在屏幕截图内容感知方面的能力，并通过分层多代理协作架构有效处理复杂用户指令和相互依赖的子任务。我们的实验证明，PC-Agent在新基准PC-Eval上相较于之前的最先进方法，任务成功率提高了32%。

papers.title: Logic-RL: Unleashing LLM Reasoning with Rule-Based Reinforcement Learning
papers.abstract: Inspired by the success of DeepSeek-R1, we explore the potential of rule-based reinforcement learning (RL) in large reasoning models. To analyze reasoning dynamics, we use synthetic logic puzzles as training data due to their controllable complexity and straightforward answer verification. We make some key technical contributions that lead to effective and stable RL training: a system prompt that emphasizes the thinking and answering process, a stringent format reward function that penalizes outputs for taking shortcuts, and a straightforward training recipe that achieves stable convergence. Our 7B model develops advanced reasoning skills-such as reflection, verification, and summarization-that are absent from the logic corpus. Remarkably, after training on just 5K logic problems, it demonstrates generalization abilities to the challenging math benchmarks AIME and AMC.

ru.title: Обучение с подкреплением раскрывает потенциал ИИ в логических рассуждениях
ru.desc: Исследователи изучают потенциал обучения с подкреплением на основе правил в больших моделях для рассуждений. Они используют синтетические логические головоломки в качестве обучающих данных, что позволяет контролировать сложность и легко проверять ответы. Ключевые технические вклады включают системный промпт, акцентирующий процесс мышления, и функцию вознаграждения, препятствующую упрощению выводов. После обучения на 5000 логических задачах, 7-миллиардная модель демонстрирует навыки рефлексии, проверки и обобщения, а также способность решать сложные математические тесты.

en.title: Enhancing Reasoning in Models with Rule-Based Reinforcement Learning
en.desc: This paper investigates the use of rule-based reinforcement learning (RL) to enhance reasoning capabilities in large models, building on the success of DeepSeek-R1. The authors utilize synthetic logic puzzles for training, which allow for controlled complexity and easy verification of answers. Key contributions include a system prompt that guides the reasoning process, a reward function that discourages shortcuts, and a training method that ensures stable convergence. The resulting 7B model exhibits advanced reasoning skills, such as reflection and verification, and shows impressive generalization to difficult math benchmarks after training on a limited dataset.

zh.title: 基于规则的强化学习助力推理模型的突破
zh.desc: 本文探讨了基于规则的强化学习在大型推理模型中的潜力，灵感来源于DeepSeek-R1的成功。我们使用合成逻辑难题作为训练数据，以分析推理动态，因为它们的复杂性可控且答案易于验证。我们提出了一些关键技术贡献，包括强调思考和回答过程的系统提示、惩罚捷径输出的严格格式奖励函数，以及实现稳定收敛的简单训练方案。经过5K逻辑问题的训练，我们的7B模型展现了反思、验证和总结等高级推理技能，并在挑战性的数学基准AIME和AMC上表现出良好的泛化能力。

papers.title: S*: Test Time Scaling for Code Generation
papers.abstract: Increasing test-time compute for LLMs shows promise across domains but remains underexplored in code generation, despite extensive study in math. In this paper, we propose S*, the first hybrid test-time scaling framework that substantially improves the coverage and selection accuracy of generated code. S* extends the existing parallel scaling paradigm with sequential scaling to push performance boundaries. It further leverages a novel selection mechanism that adaptively generates distinguishing inputs for pairwise comparison, combined with execution-grounded information to robustly identify correct solutions. We evaluate across 12 Large Language Models and Large Reasoning Model and show: (1) S* consistently improves performance across model families and sizes, enabling a 3B model to outperform GPT-4o-mini; (2) S* enables non-reasoning models to surpass reasoning models - GPT-4o-mini with S* outperforms o1-preview by 3.7% on LiveCodeBench; (3) S* further boosts state-of-the-art reasoning models - DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-32B with S* achieves 85.7% on LiveCodeBench, approaching o1 (high) at 88.5%. Code will be available under https://github.com/NovaSky-AI/SkyThought.

ru.title: S*: Революционный подход к масштабированию языковых моделей для генерации кода
ru.desc: Статья представляет S* - первую гибридную систему масштабирования во время тестирования, которая значительно улучшает охват и точность выбора генерируемого кода. S* расширяет существующую парадигму параллельного масштабирования последовательным масштабированием для повышения производительности. Система использует новый механизм выбора, который адаптивно генерирует различающиеся входные данные для попарного сравнения, в сочетании с информацией, основанной на выполнении, для надежной идентификации правильных решений. Эксперименты показывают, что S* последовательно улучшает производительность различных моделей, позволяя даже небольшим моделям превзойти более крупные.

en.title: Unlocking Code Generation Potential with S* Framework
en.desc: This paper introduces S*, a novel hybrid framework designed to enhance code generation performance during test-time for Large Language Models (LLMs). By combining parallel and sequential scaling methods, S* significantly improves both the coverage and accuracy of the generated code. The framework employs an innovative selection mechanism that generates unique inputs for pairwise comparisons, utilizing execution-grounded information to effectively identify correct solutions. Evaluation results demonstrate that S* consistently outperforms existing models, enabling smaller models to exceed the performance of larger reasoning models.

zh.title: S*：提升代码生成性能的新框架
zh.desc: 本文提出了一种新的混合测试时间扩展框架S*，旨在提高代码生成的覆盖率和选择准确性。S*结合了并行扩展和顺序扩展的方法，推动了性能的边界。它还采用了一种新颖的选择机制，通过生成区分性输入进行成对比较，并结合执行基础的信息来稳健地识别正确的解决方案。我们的评估显示，S*在多个大型语言模型中均表现出色，甚至使得非推理模型超越了推理模型。

papers.title: Scaling Text-Rich Image Understanding via Code-Guided Synthetic Multimodal Data Generation
papers.abstract: Reasoning about images with rich text, such as charts and documents, is a critical application of vision-language models (VLMs). However, VLMs often struggle in these domains due to the scarcity of diverse text-rich vision-language data. To address this challenge, we present CoSyn, a framework that leverages the coding capabilities of text-only large language models (LLMs) to automatically create synthetic text-rich multimodal data. Given input text describing a target domain (e.g., "nutrition fact labels"), CoSyn prompts an LLM to generate code (Python, HTML, LaTeX, etc.) for rendering synthetic images. With the underlying code as textual representations of the synthetic images, CoSyn can generate high-quality instruction-tuning data, again relying on a text-only LLM. Using CoSyn, we constructed a dataset comprising 400K images and 2.7M rows of vision-language instruction-tuning data. Comprehensive experiments on seven benchmarks demonstrate that models trained on our synthetic data achieve state-of-the-art performance among competitive open-source models, including Llama 3.2, and surpass proprietary models such as GPT-4V and Gemini 1.5 Flash. Furthermore, CoSyn can produce synthetic pointing data, enabling VLMs to ground information within input images, showcasing its potential for developing multimodal agents capable of acting in real-world environments.

ru.title: CoSyn: синтетические данные для прорыва в мультимодальном ИИ
ru.desc: Статья представляет CoSyn - фреймворк для создания синтетических мультимодальных данных с использованием больших языковых моделей. CoSyn генерирует код для создания изображений и текстовые описания к ним, что позволяет обучать модели компьютерного зрения и обработки естественного языка. Авторы создали датасет из 400 тысяч изображений и 2,7 миллиона строк обучающих данных. Эксперименты показали, что модели, обученные на этих данных, превосходят существующие открытые и проприетарные решения на ряде бенчмарков.

en.title: CoSyn: Bridging Text and Vision with Synthetic Data Generation
en.desc: This paper introduces CoSyn, a framework designed to enhance vision-language models (VLMs) by generating synthetic text-rich multimodal data. CoSyn utilizes large language models (LLMs) to automatically create code that renders synthetic images based on textual descriptions of specific domains. By generating a substantial dataset of 400K images and 2.7M rows of instruction-tuning data, CoSyn enables VLMs to achieve superior performance on various benchmarks. The framework also facilitates the creation of synthetic pointing data, which helps VLMs to better understand and interact with real-world images.

zh.title: 合成数据助力视觉语言模型的突破
zh.desc: 本论文介绍了一种名为CoSyn的框架，旨在解决视觉语言模型（VLMs）在处理富文本图像时的挑战。CoSyn利用大型语言模型（LLMs）的编码能力，自动生成合成的文本丰富的多模态数据。通过输入描述目标领域的文本，CoSyn可以生成用于渲染合成图像的代码，从而创建高质量的指令调优数据。实验结果表明，使用CoSyn生成的数据使得模型在多个基准测试中表现优异，超越了许多竞争对手的开源模型。

papers.title: Dynamic Concepts Personalization from Single Videos
papers.abstract: Personalizing generative text-to-image models has seen remarkable progress, but extending this personalization to text-to-video models presents unique challenges. Unlike static concepts, personalizing text-to-video models has the potential to capture dynamic concepts, i.e., entities defined not only by their appearance but also by their motion. In this paper, we introduce Set-and-Sequence, a novel framework for personalizing Diffusion Transformers (DiTs)-based generative video models with dynamic concepts. Our approach imposes a spatio-temporal weight space within an architecture that does not explicitly separate spatial and temporal features. This is achieved in two key stages. First, we fine-tune Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) layers using an unordered set of frames from the video to learn an identity LoRA basis that represents the appearance, free from temporal interference. In the second stage, with the identity LoRAs frozen, we augment their coefficients with Motion Residuals and fine-tune them on the full video sequence, capturing motion dynamics. Our Set-and-Sequence framework results in a spatio-temporal weight space that effectively embeds dynamic concepts into the video model's output domain, enabling unprecedented editability and compositionality while setting a new benchmark for personalizing dynamic concepts.

ru.title: Динамическая персонализация видео с помощью Set-and-Sequence
ru.desc: Статья представляет новый метод под названием Set-and-Sequence для персонализации генеративных видеомоделей на основе диффузионных трансформеров (DiTs) с динамическими концепциями. Метод использует двухэтапный подход: сначала обучается базис LoRA для представления внешнего вида объекта, а затем добавляются Motion Residuals для захвата динамики движения. Это позволяет создать пространство весов, эффективно встраивающее динамические концепции в выходной домен видеомодели. Предложенный подход обеспечивает беспрецедентную редактируемость и композиционность, устанавливая новый эталон для персонализации динамических концепций в генеративных видеомоделях.

en.title: Dynamic Personalization for Video Generation
en.desc: This paper addresses the challenges of personalizing text-to-video models, which need to account for both appearance and motion of entities. The authors propose a new framework called Set-and-Sequence, designed for Diffusion Transformers (DiTs) that focuses on dynamic concepts. The framework operates in two stages: first, it fine-tunes Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) layers using a set of unordered video frames to capture appearance, and then it incorporates Motion Residuals to learn motion dynamics. This innovative approach enhances the model's ability to generate videos with personalized dynamic content, improving editability and compositionality.

zh.title: 个性化动态视频生成的新突破
zh.desc: 个性化生成文本到视频模型面临独特挑战，因为视频不仅涉及静态概念，还包括动态概念。本文提出了一种新框架，称为Set-and-Sequence，用于个性化基于扩散变换器的生成视频模型。该方法通过在不明确分离空间和时间特征的架构中引入时空权重空间，来捕捉动态概念。通过两个关键阶段的调整，我们的框架实现了对动态概念的有效嵌入，提升了视频模型的可编辑性和组合性。

papers.title: AlphaMaze: Enhancing Large Language Models' Spatial Intelligence via GRPO
papers.abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in language processing, yet they often struggle with tasks requiring genuine visual spatial reasoning. In this paper, we introduce a novel two-stage training framework designed to equip standard LLMs with visual reasoning abilities for maze navigation. First, we leverage Supervised Fine Tuning (SFT) on a curated dataset of tokenized maze representations to teach the model to predict step-by-step movement commands. Next, we apply Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO)-a technique used in DeepSeekR1-with a carefully crafted reward function to refine the model's sequential decision-making and encourage emergent chain-of-thought behaviors. Experimental results on synthetically generated mazes show that while a baseline model fails to navigate the maze, the SFT-trained model achieves 86% accuracy, and further GRPO fine-tuning boosts accuracy to 93%. Qualitative analyses reveal that GRPO fosters more robust and self-corrective reasoning, highlighting the potential of our approach to bridge the gap between language models and visual spatial tasks. These findings offer promising implications for applications in robotics, autonomous navigation, and other domains that require integrated visual and sequential reasoning.

ru.title: Обучение языковых моделей визуальному мышлению для навигации в лабиринтах
ru.desc: В этой статье представлен новый двухэтапный метод обучения языковых моделей (LLM) навыкам визуального мышления для навигации в лабиринтах. На первом этапе используется контролируемая точная настройка (SFT) на специально подготовленном наборе данных токенизированных представлений лабиринтов. Затем применяется групповая относительная оптимизация стратегии (GRPO) с тщательно разработанной функцией вознаграждения для улучшения последовательного принятия решений моделью. Экспериментальные результаты показывают значительное улучшение точности навигации в лабиринтах по сравнению с базовой моделью.

en.title: Empowering Language Models with Visual Reasoning for Maze Navigation
en.desc: This paper presents a new training method to enhance Large Language Models (LLMs) with visual reasoning skills for navigating mazes. The approach consists of two stages: first, Supervised Fine Tuning (SFT) is used to train the model on maze data to predict movement commands. Then, Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) is applied to improve the model's decision-making and encourage logical reasoning. The results show that the enhanced model significantly outperforms the baseline, achieving high accuracy in maze navigation, which suggests a promising direction for integrating language models with visual tasks.

zh.title: 赋予语言模型视觉推理能力的创新训练框架
zh.desc: 本文提出了一种新颖的两阶段训练框架，旨在为大型语言模型（LLMs）赋予视觉推理能力，以便进行迷宫导航。首先，我们通过监督微调（SFT）在经过精心策划的迷宫表示数据集上训练模型，使其能够逐步预测移动指令。接着，我们应用群体相对策略优化（GRPO）技术，结合精心设计的奖励函数，进一步提升模型的决策能力和思维链条行为。实验结果表明，经过SFT训练的模型在迷宫导航中取得了86%的准确率，而经过GRPO微调后，准确率提升至93%。

papers.title: MLGym: A New Framework and Benchmark for Advancing AI Research Agents
papers.abstract: We introduce Meta MLGym and MLGym-Bench, a new framework and benchmark for evaluating and developing LLM agents on AI research tasks. This is the first Gym environment for machine learning (ML) tasks, enabling research on reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms for training such agents. MLGym-bench consists of 13 diverse and open-ended AI research tasks from diverse domains such as computer vision, natural language processing, reinforcement learning, and game theory. Solving these tasks requires real-world AI research skills such as generating new ideas and hypotheses, creating and processing data, implementing ML methods, training models, running experiments, analyzing the results, and iterating through this process to improve on a given task. We evaluate a number of frontier large language models (LLMs) on our benchmarks such as Claude-3.5-Sonnet, Llama-3.1 405B, GPT-4o, o1-preview, and Gemini-1.5 Pro. Our MLGym framework makes it easy to add new tasks, integrate and evaluate models or agents, generate synthetic data at scale, as well as develop new learning algorithms for training agents on AI research tasks. We find that current frontier models can improve on the given baselines, usually by finding better hyperparameters, but do not generate novel hypotheses, algorithms, architectures, or substantial improvements. We open-source our framework and benchmark to facilitate future research in advancing the AI research capabilities of LLM agents.

ru.title: Новая среда для оценки исследовательских способностей ИИ-агентов
ru.desc: Статья представляет Meta MLGym и MLGym-Bench - новую среду и бенчмарк для оценки и разработки LLM-агентов для задач исследования ИИ. Это первая Gym-среда для задач машинного обучения, позволяющая исследовать алгоритмы обучения с подкреплением для тренировки таких агентов. MLGym-bench включает 13 разнообразных открытых задач из областей компьютерного зрения, обработки естественного языка, обучения с подкреплением и теории игр. Авторы оценивают несколько современных больших языковых моделей на своих бенчмарках и обнаруживают, что текущие модели могут улучшить базовые показатели, но не генерируют существенно новых идей или алгоритмов.

en.title: Empowering LLMs to Tackle AI Research Challenges
en.desc: Meta MLGym and MLGym-Bench are innovative frameworks designed to evaluate and develop large language model (LLM) agents on various AI research tasks. This framework serves as the first Gym environment tailored for machine learning tasks, allowing researchers to apply reinforcement learning (RL) techniques to train agents. The benchmark includes 13 diverse tasks from fields like computer vision and natural language processing, requiring skills such as data generation, model training, and experimental analysis. While current LLMs can optimize existing methods, they struggle to create novel ideas or significant advancements in AI research.

zh.title: 推动AI研究的全新框架与基准
zh.desc: 我们介绍了Meta MLGym和MLGym-Bench，这是一个新的框架和基准，用于评估和开发在AI研究任务上的大型语言模型（LLM）代理。MLGym-Bench包含来自计算机视觉、自然语言处理、强化学习和博弈论等多个领域的13个多样化和开放式的AI研究任务。解决这些任务需要真实的AI研究技能，例如生成新想法和假设、创建和处理数据、实施机器学习方法、训练模型、运行实验、分析结果并迭代改进。我们的框架使得添加新任务、集成和评估模型或代理、生成大规模合成数据以及开发新的学习算法变得更加容易。

papers.title: Discovering highly efficient low-weight quantum error-correcting codes with reinforcement learning
papers.abstract: The realization of scalable fault-tolerant quantum computing is expected to hinge on quantum error-correcting codes. In the quest for more efficient quantum fault tolerance, a critical code parameter is the weight of measurements that extract information about errors to enable error correction: as higher measurement weights require higher implementation costs and introduce more errors, it is important in code design to optimize measurement weight. This underlies the surging interest in quantum low-density parity-check (qLDPC) codes, the study of which has primarily focused on the asymptotic (large-code-limit) properties. In this work, we introduce a versatile and computationally efficient approach to stabilizer code weight reduction based on reinforcement learning (RL), which produces new low-weight codes that substantially outperform the state of the art in practically relevant parameter regimes, extending significantly beyond previously accessible small distances. For example, our approach demonstrates savings in physical qubit overhead compared to existing results by 1 to 2 orders of magnitude for weight 6 codes and brings the overhead into a feasible range for near-future experiments. We also investigate the interplay between code parameters using our RL framework, offering new insights into the potential efficiency and power of practically viable coding strategies. Overall, our results demonstrate how RL can effectively advance the crucial yet challenging problem of quantum code discovery and thereby facilitate a faster path to the practical implementation of fault-tolerant quantum technologies.

ru.title: Обучение с подкреплением открывает путь к эффективным квантовым кодам
ru.desc: Статья посвящена применению обучения с подкреплением (RL) для оптимизации квантовых кодов коррекции ошибок. Авторы предлагают новый подход к уменьшению веса стабилизаторных кодов, который превосходит современные методы в практически значимых режимах. Их метод позволяет сократить накладные расходы на физические кубиты на 1-2 порядка для кодов веса 6. Исследование также раскрывает взаимосвязь между параметрами кодов, предоставляя новые идеи для разработки эффективных стратегий квантового кодирования.

en.title: Reinforcement Learning: A Game Changer for Quantum Error Correction
en.desc: This paper discusses the importance of quantum error-correcting codes for scalable fault-tolerant quantum computing, focusing on optimizing the measurement weight used in error correction. The authors present a novel approach using reinforcement learning (RL) to reduce the weight of stabilizer codes, resulting in new low-weight codes that outperform existing methods. Their findings show significant reductions in physical qubit overhead, making these codes more practical for near-future quantum experiments. Additionally, the study explores the relationships between various code parameters, providing insights that could enhance the efficiency of quantum coding strategies.

zh.title: 优化量子错误纠正码的强化学习方法
zh.desc: 这篇论文探讨了量子容错计算中的量子错误纠正码，特别是测量权重的优化。测量权重越高，实施成本和错误率也越高，因此在代码设计中优化测量权重至关重要。研究者们提出了一种基于强化学习的高效方法，能够生成新的低权重代码，显著超越现有技术。该方法在物理量子比特的开销上实现了1到2个数量级的节省，为未来实验提供了可行的解决方案。

papers.title: RelaCtrl: Relevance-Guided Efficient Control for Diffusion Transformers
papers.abstract: The Diffusion Transformer plays a pivotal role in advancing text-to-image and text-to-video generation, owing primarily to its inherent scalability. However, existing controlled diffusion transformer methods incur significant parameter and computational overheads and suffer from inefficient resource allocation due to their failure to account for the varying relevance of control information across different transformer layers. To address this, we propose the Relevance-Guided Efficient Controllable Generation framework, RelaCtrl, enabling efficient and resource-optimized integration of control signals into the Diffusion Transformer. First, we evaluate the relevance of each layer in the Diffusion Transformer to the control information by assessing the "ControlNet Relevance Score"-i.e., the impact of skipping each control layer on both the quality of generation and the control effectiveness during inference. Based on the strength of the relevance, we then tailor the positioning, parameter scale, and modeling capacity of the control layers to reduce unnecessary parameters and redundant computations. Additionally, to further improve efficiency, we replace the self-attention and FFN in the commonly used copy block with the carefully designed Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer (TDSM), enabling efficient implementation of both the token mixer and channel mixer. Both qualitative and quantitative experimental results demonstrate that our approach achieves superior performance with only 15% of the parameters and computational complexity compared to PixArt-delta. More examples are available at https://relactrl.github.io/RelaCtrl/.

University of Science and Technology of China

ru.title: Эффективный контроль генерации изображений с помощью релевантности слоев
ru.desc: В статье представлен метод RelaCtrl для эффективного контролируемого генерирования изображений и видео с помощью Диффузионного Трансформера. Авторы предлагают оценивать релевантность каждого слоя трансформера для контрольной информации, используя 'ControlNet Relevance Score'. На основе этой оценки оптимизируется размещение, масштаб параметров и моделирующая способность контрольных слоев. Также вводится новый компонент Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer (TDSM) для повышения эффективности. Эксперименты показывают, что RelaCtrl достигает лучших результатов при использовании всего 15% параметров и вычислительной сложности по сравнению с PixArt-delta.

en.title: Efficient Control for Diffusion Transformers with RelaCtrl
en.desc: The paper introduces the RelaCtrl framework, which enhances the efficiency of the Diffusion Transformer for text-to-image and text-to-video generation. It addresses the high computational costs and parameter overheads of existing methods by evaluating the relevance of control information across different transformer layers. By optimizing the integration of control signals based on their relevance, RelaCtrl reduces unnecessary computations and parameters. Additionally, it employs a new Two-Dimensional Shuffle Mixer to improve the efficiency of the model's architecture, achieving better performance with significantly lower resource usage.

zh.title: 高效可控生成的革命性框架
zh.desc: 本文提出了一种新的框架，称为RelaCtrl，旨在提高扩散变换器在文本到图像和文本到视频生成中的效率。通过评估每一层与控制信息的相关性，RelaCtrl能够优化控制信号的集成，减少不必要的参数和计算。我们还引入了二维混合器（TDSM），替代传统的自注意力机制，以进一步提升计算效率。实验结果表明，RelaCtrl在参数和计算复杂度上仅为PixArt-delta的15%，但性能更优。

zh.text: 我们介绍了Qwen2.5-VL，这是Qwen视觉-语言系列的最新旗舰模型。它在基础能力和创新功能方面取得了显著进展。Qwen2.5-VL在视觉识别、精确定位、文档解析和长视频理解方面有很大提升。它能准确定位物体，提取结构化数据，分析图表和布局。模型可以处理不同尺寸的图像和长时间的视频，具有动态分辨率处理和绝对时间编码功能。Qwen2.5-VL在静态图像、文档理解和实际场景中表现出色，可以进行推理、工具使用和任务执行。它有三种尺寸，适用于从边缘AI到高性能计算的各种用例。
zh.title: Qwen2.5-VL Technical Report
zh.pinyin:
我们介绍了Qwen2.5-VL，这是Qwen视觉-语言系列的最新旗舰模型。它在基础能力和创新功能方面取得了显著进展。Qwen2.5-VL在视觉识别、精确定位、文档解析和长视频理解方面有很大提升。它能准确定位物体，提取结构化数据，分析图表和布局。模型可以处理不同尺寸的图像和长时间的视频，具有动态分辨率处理和绝对时间编码功能。Qwen2.5-VL在静态图像、文档理解和实际场景中表现出色，可以进行推理、工具使用和任务执行。它有三种尺寸，适用于从边缘AI到高性能计算的各种用例。

Wǒmen jièshào le Qwen2.5-VL, zhè shì Qwen shìjué-yǔyán xìliè de zuìxīn qíjiàn móxíng. Tā zài jīchǔ nénglì hé chuàngxīn gōngnéng fāngmiàn qǔdé le xiǎnzhù jìnbù. Qwen2.5-VL zài shìjué shíbié, jīngquè dìngwèi, wéndáng jiěxī hé cháng shìpín lǐjiě fāngmiàn yǒu hěnduō tíshēng. Tā néng zhǔnquè dìngwèi wùtǐ, tíqué jiégòuhuà shùjù, fēnxi túbiǎo hé bùjú. Móxíng kěyǐ chǔlǐ bùtóng chǐcùn de túxiàng hé cháng shíjiān de shìpín, jùyǒu dòngtài fēnbiǎolǜ chǔlǐ hé juéduì shíjiān biānmǎ gōngnéng. Qwen2.5-VL zài jìngtài túxiàng, wéndáng lǐjiě hé shíjì chǎngjīng zhōng biǎoxiàn chūsè, kěyǐ jìnxíng tuí lǐ, gōngjù shǐyòng hé rènwù zhíxíng. Tā yǒu sān zhǒng chǐcùn, shìyòng yú cóng biānjué AI dào gāo xíngnéng jìsuàn de gèzhǒng yònglì.

zh.trans: We introduce Qwen2.5-VL, the latest flagship model in the Qwen visual-language series. It has made significant advancements in both foundational capabilities and innovative features. Qwen2.5-VL has seen substantial improvements in visual recognition, precise localization, document parsing, and long video understanding. It can accurately locate objects, extract structured data, analyze charts and layouts. The model can handle images of various sizes and long-duration videos, featuring dynamic resolution processing and absolute time encoding. Qwen2.5-VL excels in static image understanding, document comprehension, and real-world scenarios, capable of reasoning, tool use, and task execution. It comes in three sizes, suitable for a range of applications from edge AI to high-performance computing.
